note_text:
Procedure: EBUS-TBNA + Forceps Biopsy.
- Stations 4R and 7 sampled.
- 4R: 21G needle x3, Mini-forceps x4.
- 7: Mini-forceps x3.
- ROSE: Granulomatous inflammation.
- No complications.

notes: EBUS-TBNA with sampling of 2 stations (4R, 7) supports 31652 (1-2 stations).
Intranodal forceps biopsy is included in the EBUS-TBNA code family as an advanced sampling technique under the same guidance.

coding_review.rationale: EBUS-TBNA with intranodal forceps biopsy of stations 4R and 7 is best captured with 31652 (EBUS with TBNA) plus 31653 (increased complexity/intranodal technique). Transbronchial lung biopsy code 31629 was removed because no parenchymal lung biopsy was performed, and diagnostic bronchoscopy 31622 is bundled into the EBUS codes under the diagnostic-with-surgical bundling policy.

note_text: The patient presented for evaluation of mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) was utilized to visualize stations 4R and 7. Given prior non-diagnostic TBNAs, an intranodal forceps biopsy technique was employed. The 21G needle created a track, followed by the advancement of 1.1mm mini-forceps under sonographic guidance. Histological cores were obtained, revealing necrotizing granulomas.

notes: EBUS-TBNA with sampling of 2 stations (4R, 7) supports 31652 (1-2 stations).
Intranodal forceps biopsy is included in the EBUS-TBNA code family as an advanced sampling technique under the same guidance.

coding_review.rationale: EBUS-TBNA with intranodal forceps biopsy of stations 4R and 7 is best captured with 31652 (EBUS with TBNA) plus 31653 (increased complexity/intranodal technique). Transbronchial lung biopsy code 31629 was removed because no parenchymal lung biopsy was performed, and diagnostic bronchoscopy 31622 is bundled into the EBUS codes under the diagnostic-with-surgical bundling policy.

note_text: CPT 31653 (EBUS sampling 3+ stations) is NOT applicable; only stations 4R and 7 were sampled. Correct coding is 31652 (EBUS 1-2 stations). Procedure involved advanced intranodal forceps biopsy technique to obtain histology after cytology was non-diagnostic. Ultrasound guidance used throughout.

notes: EBUS-TBNA with sampling of 2 stations (4R, 7) supports 31652 (1-2 stations).
Intranodal forceps biopsy is included in the EBUS-TBNA code family as an advanced sampling technique under the same guidance.

Transbronchial lung biopsy code 31629 was removed because no parenchymal lung biopsy was performed, and diagnostic bronchoscopy 31622 is bundled into the EBUS codes under the diagnostic-with-surgical bundling policy.

5. Hemostasis achieved. Patient stable.

note_text: EBUS-Guided Intranodal Forceps Biopsy was performed on a 61-year-old male with mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Stations 4R and 7 were targeted. 21G needle created access for 1.1mm mini-forceps. Core biopsies obtained from both stations showed necrotizing granulomatous inflammation. No complications were noted.

note_text:
[Indication]
Mediastinal lymphadenopathy, prior non-diagnostic TBNA.
[Anesthesia]
Moderate Sedation (Versed/Fentanyl).
[Description]
EBUS-TBNA and Intranodal Forceps Biopsy of stations 4R and 7. Granulomatous inflammation found.
[Plan]
ID Consult, cultures pending.

notes: EBUS-TBNA with sampling of 2 stations (4R, 7) supports 31652 (1-2 stations).
Intranodal forceps biopsy is included in the EBUS-TBNA code family as an advanced sampling technique under the same guidance.

note_text: Mr. Anderson was brought to the bronchoscopy suite for investigation of his mediastinal adenopathy. We used an EBUS scope to localize stations 4R and 7. Because standard needle aspiration was inconclusive, we utilized a mini-forceps technique to obtain larger tissue cores from inside the nodes. This successfully yielded diagnostic tissue showing granulomas.

notes: EBUS-TBNA with sampling of 2 stations (4R, 7) supports 31652 (1-2 stations).

note_text: We visualized the mediastinal targets using EBUS. We navigated the needle into station 4R and 7. Subsequently, we deployed mini-forceps through the needle tract to acquire core tissue samples. The pathology evaluation indicated granulomatous disease.

notes: EBUS-TBNA with sampling of 2 stations (4R, 7) supports 31652 (1-2 stations).

note_text:
Procedure: Therapeutic Thoracentesis (Right).
- US Guidance used.
- 8th ICS, Mid-axillary line.
- 1400 mL serosanguinous fluid removed.
- No pneumothorax on post-procedure US.

coding_review.rationale: The note documents a single ultrasound-guided thoracentesis with both diagnostic fluid sampling and therapeutic removal of 1.4 L, supporting 32554 and 32555. No pleural catheter or lung ablation was performed, so ablation-related registry fields were corrected and the attending name was updated to match the dictated report.

note_text: A therapeutic thoracentesis was performed for symptomatic relief of a right-sided pleural effusion in the setting of congestive heart failure. Under ultrasound guidance, a 16-gauge catheter was introduced into the 8th intercostal space. 1,400 mL of serosanguinous fluid was evacuated. The patient tolerated the procedure with significant symptomatic improvement.

coding_review.rationale: The note documents a single ultrasound-guided thoracentesis with both diagnostic fluid sampling and therapeutic removal of 1.4 L, supporting 32554 and 32555. No pleural catheter or lung ablation was performed, so ablation-related registry fields were corrected and the attending name was updated to match the dictated report.

note_text: Billing Code 32555 (Thoracentesis with Imaging Guidance). 32554 is incorrect as Ultrasound was explicitly used for needle placement and safety. Fluid (1400mL) removed for therapeutic intent. Patient on anticoagulation (Warfarin), managed appropriately.

note_text:
Procedure: Rigid Bronchoscopy, Tumor Debulking, Y-Stent.
- 12mm rigid scope used.
- APC/Cryo used to debulk trachea/mainstems.
- 15x12x12 Silicone Y-stent placed.
- Airways >90% patent post-procedure.

notes: 31631 (Tracheal stent placement) for Y-stent involving trachea/mainstems.
31641 (Tumor destruction) for APC/cryo debulking of central obstruction.

coding_review.rationale: Rigid bronchoscopy with malignant tumor debulking and placement of a silicone tracheobronchial Y-stent is appropriately coded with 31631 for tracheobronchial stent placement, with 31622 retained for the diagnostic airway survey. No additional dilation or tumor-destruction codes were added because those maneuvers were performed in the same segment as the stent and treated as integral in this review; the attending name was corrected to the operating physician documented in the note.

note_text: The patient underwent rigid bronchoscopy for management of malignant central airway obstruction involving the distal trachea and carina. Following mechanical and thermal debulking (APC/Cryotherapy) of the tumor, a silicone Y-stent was customized and deployed. Post-deployment inspection revealed excellent patency of the tracheal and bronchial limbs.

notes: 31631 (Tracheal stent placement) for Y-stent involving trachea/mainstems.
31641 (Tumor destruction) for APC/cryo debulking of central obstruction.

coding_review.rationale: Rigid bronchoscopy with malignant tumor debulking and placement of a silicone tracheobronchial Y-stent is appropriately coded with 31631 for tracheobronchial stent placement, with 31622 retained for the diagnostic airway survey. note_text: CPT 31636 (Stent placement) and 31641 (Tumor destruction) are supported. 31622 is bundled. Complex airway management required rigid bronchoscopy and jet ventilation. Y-stent placement required removal and re-insertion of rigid scope.

note_text:
Procedure: Robotic Bronchoscopy (Ion).
- Target: 2.7cm RUL nodule.
- Nav + REBUS confirmed.
- TBBx x7, Brush x3, Wash.
- ROSE: Squamous malignancy.

notes: Removed 31623 (Brush) as it is generally bundled with biopsy of the same site/lesion under NCCI.

coding_review.rationale: The EMN-guided bronchoscopy included BAL, brushings, transbronchial lung biopsies, radial EBUS, and computer-assisted navigation of a peripheral RUL lesion. CPT 31628 (transbronchial lung biopsy), 31624 (BAL), and +31627 (navigation add-on) were added to the originally extracted 31623 and +31654 to reflect the documented work, while 31622 remains appropriately bundled under the diagnostic-with-surgical rule.

note_text: Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy was performed utilizing the Ion robotic platform to target a spiculated RUL nodule. Radial EBUS confirmed concentric probe placement. Transbronchial biopsies and brushings yielded a diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma on rapid on-site evaluation.

notes: Removed 31623 (Brush) as it is generally bundled with biopsy of the same site/lesion under NCCI.

note_text: Codes: 31628 (Lung biopsy), 31627 (Nav add-on), 31654 (REBUS add-on), 31624 (BAL). 31623 bundled. Robotic platform used for navigation to peripheral RUL lesion (2.7cm).

notes: Removed 31623 (Brush) as it is generally bundled with biopsy of the same site/lesion under NCCI.

note_text:
Procedure: PleurX Catheter Placement (Left).
- Indication: Malignant Mesothelioma.
- US Guided.
- 1200 mL drained.
- Catheter functional, patient comfortable.

notes: Tunneled pleural catheter placement (32550) includes guidance and initial drainage.

coding_review.rationale: This procedure is an initial placement of a tunneled PleurX indwelling pleural catheter for malignant effusion, which is accurately captured by 32550 alone. Code 32560 (instillation of pleurodesis agent) was removed because no chemical pleurodesis was performed and fluid drainage through the new catheter is inherent to 32550; the attending name was aligned with the report.

note_text: A tunneled indwelling pleural catheter (PleurX) was placed for palliative management of refractory malignant pleural effusion secondary to mesothelioma. Ultrasound guidance ensured safe placement despite loculations. 1,200 mL of fluid was drained, and the patient and family were educated on catheter care.

notes: Tunneled pleural catheter placement (32550) includes guidance and initial drainage.

note_text:
[Indication]
Refractory malignant pleural effusion (Mesothelioma).
[Anesthesia]
Local + Midazolam.
[Description]
US-guided PleurX placement left side. 1200 mL drained.
[Plan]
Hospice management, home drainage.

notes: Tunneled pleural catheter placement (32550) includes guidance and initial drainage.

coding_review.rationale: This procedure is an initial placement of a tunneled PleurX indwelling pleural catheter for malignant effusion, which is accurately captured by 32550 alone. Code 32560 (instillation of pleurodesis agent) was removed because no chemical pleurodesis was performed and fluid drainage through the new catheter is inherent to 32550; the attending name was aligned with the report.

note_text: Mr. Bradford has a recurring fluid buildup due to mesothelioma. To help him breathe better at home, we placed a permanent PleurX drainage tube. We drained over a liter of fluid during the procedure, and he will now be managed by hospice nurses.

notes: Tunneled pleural catheter placement (32550) includes guidance and initial drainage.

note_text: We inserted a tunneled pleural catheter under sonographic guidance. We evacuated 1,200 mL of effusion. The device was secured, and the patient was instructed on home drainage protocols.

note_text:
Procedure: Medical Pleuroscopy (Left).
- Findings: Parietal pleural thickening/inflammation.
- Interventions: Biopsies x10, Talc Poudrage (5g).
- 24 Fr Chest Tube placed.

notes: Thoracoscopy with pleurodesis (32650) includes the talc insufflation and the scope insertion.
Separate coding of 32601 (Diagnostic) and 32560 (Chemical pleurodesis via tube) is incorrect when performed via thoracoscopy.

coding_review.rationale: The note describes a medical pleuroscopy with pleural biopsies, talc pleurodesis, and placement of a 16 Fr chest tube. This supports 32601 (diagnostic pleuroscopy with biopsy), 32560 (instillation of pleurodesis agent via chest tube), and 32551 (tube thoracostomy). VATS pleurodesis code 32650 was removed as inappropriate for a medical pleuroscopy, and spurious peripheral lung ablation fields were cleared; the attending name was corrected.

note_text: Medical pleuroscopy was performed to investigate an undiagnosed exudative left pleural effusion. Inspection revealed focal parietal pleural thickening suggestive of malignancy or pleuritis. Multiple biopsies were obtained. Talc poudrage was performed for pleurodesis given the lung's ability to re-expand.

note_text:
Procedure: EBUS-TBNA Staging.
- Target: N3 disease confirmation.
- Sampled: 7, 4L, 10L, 11L.
- ROSE: Malignant cells in all stations.
- Dx: Stage IIIB Adenocarcinoma.

notes: EBUS-TBNA with sampling of 4 stations (7, 4L, 10L, 11L) supports 31653 (3+ stations).

coding_review.rationale: Systematic linear EBUS-TBNA of multiple mediastinal and hilar stations (7, 4L, 10L, 11L) with positive staging findings is appropriately captured by 31653 alone. Transbronchial lung biopsy code 31629 was removed because there was no parenchymal biopsy, and 31622 was dropped under the diagnostic-with-surgical rule; the attending name was updated to the documented operator, Dr. Thai Nguyen.

note_text: Systematic EBUS-TBNA was performed for mediastinal staging of known LLL adenocarcinoma. Lymph node stations 7, 4L, 10L, and 11L were sampled. Rapid on-site evaluation confirmed malignancy in all stations, establishing a diagnosis of N3 disease (Stage IIIB).

note_text:
Procedure: Ion Robotic Bronchoscopy.
- Target: 2.6cm RLL nodule.
- Nav/REBUS confirmed.
- TBBx/Brush/BAL performed.
- ROSE: Atypical cells.
- No complications.

notes: Chartis (31634) is bundled when performed in the same session/lobe as valve placement.

coding_review.rationale: The Ion robotic bronchoscopy case included BAL, brushings, navigational transbronchial lung biopsies (including cryobiopsy), transbronchial needle aspiration, radial EBUS, and chest tube placement for pneumothorax. This supports 31626 (TBLB), 31628 (TBNA), 31624 (BAL), 31623 (brushings), add-ons +31627 (navigation) and +31654 (radial EBUS), plus 32551 for tube thoracostomy. Diagnostic bronchoscopy 31622 was removed as bundled when higher-intensity biopsy and radial EBUS codes are billed.

note_text:
Procedure: BLVR LUL.
- Chartis: CV Negative.
- 3 Zephyr valves placed (Apical-post, Anterior, Superior).
- Complete occlusion confirmed.
- No pneumothorax.

coding_review.rationale: Bronchoscopic lung volume reduction with Zephyr valve placement in the left upper lobe after Chartis balloon occlusion testing is primarily represented by 31647 for endobronchial valve placement. Code 31634 was removed because Chartis assessment is treated as bundled when performed in the same session and lobe as valve placement; 31622 was retained to reflect the diagnostic airway inspection preceding BLVR.

note_text: Bronchoscopic lung volume reduction was performed for severe heterogeneous emphysema. Chartis assessment of the LUL confirmed the absence of collateral ventilation. Three Zephyr valves were deployed, achieving complete lobar occlusion. The patient tolerated the procedure well.
